subject: News Summary
body:
CBSNews.com






May 21, 2007

TOP STORIESJimmy Carter To Bush: Never Mind
Former President Jimmy Carter called his remarks "careless or misinterpreted" when he said the Bush administration was the
                        "worst in history" for its impact around the world. Mr. Carter said he only meant to compare President Bush with Nixon. More...Watch: Carter Bashes Bush
• Midwest Bracing For Cicada Invasion• Lebanon's Fight With Militants Heats Up• Historic 19th Century Ship Burns In London
                     					| WatchU.S.Idaho Rampage Still A Mystery
It appears the gunman fired into the Moscow, Idaho, emergency dispatch center to draw out officers, then picked them off as
                        they emerged. The sniper then retreated into a church. One officer is dead, along with the church sexton and gunman. More...
• Midwest Bracing For Cicada Invasion• Major Progress On Wildfires Nationwide• Dumped On Skid Row
                     					| Watch• More StoriesWorldLebanon's Fight With Militants Heats Up
Lebanon's army opened fire with tanks and artillery on a refugee camp, in its battle with a militia run by a self-professed
                        disciple of Osama bin Laden. Lebanon's police commander scoffs at the al Qaeda link. "This is imitation al Qaeda." More...
• Historic 19th Century Ship Burns In London
                     					| Watch• Bomb Kills 7, Search For GIs Continues
                     					| Watch• Israel Continues Air Strikes On Gaza• More StoriesPoliticsGOP Losing Battle Of The Internet
Democrats have taken a big early edge over Republicans in one of the key arenas where the 2008 presidential contest will be
                        played out: the Internet.
                        Joel Roberts has the highlights of the day's headlines. More...
• Jimmy Carter To Bush: Never Mind
                     					| Watch• Clinton Proposes Pre-K Access For All Kids• Immigration Battle Begins In Senate• More StoriesHealthWhen "Senior Moments" Begin
On The Early Show, an expert on aging tells whether to be concerned, and how to keep your memory sharp as you
                        progress through middle-age. More...Watch: Improving Your Memory
• Teen Slims Down With Gastric Bypass• Sick Infant In Life Support Debate Dies• Lobbying Kills Mandatory Cancer Vaccine
                     					| Watch• More StoriesSciTechMidwest Bracing For Cicada Invasion
The Midwest is about to get noisy. "Brood XIII", the next generation of the 17 year cicada, is about to take over the trees,
                        air and ground. Dogs have a big snack to come, but some outdoor events planners have a major headache on their hands. More...
• Wayward Whales Headed Back To Sea
                     					| Watch• Alltel Acquired For $27.5B• GOP Losing Battle Of The Internet• More StoriesBusinessAlltel Acquired For $27.5B
Investment firms TPG Capital and GS Capital Partners have agreed to acquire Alltel Corp., the fifth-biggest U.S. wireless
                        company and owner of the nation's largest geographic network, in a deal worth $27.5 billion. More...
• Gas Prices Hit An All-Time High
                     					| Watch• James Dyson Keeps Innovating• Money Saving Tips
                     					| Watch• More StoriesEntertainmentBrangelina Takes On Cannes
Angelina Jolie, Marianne Pearl and Brad Pitt, the movie's co-producer, were at the Cannes Film Festival on Monday for the
                        premiere of "A Mighty Heart," about Daniel Pearl's abduction and murder in Pakistan in 2002. More...Watch: Brangelina Arrives At Cannes
• Three Could Be Charm Twice For Bloom
                     					| Watch• McCartney: I Don't Read Divorce Coverage• Australia Fines Sly For Toting Hormones• More StoriesOpinionThompson Doing Things His Way
Fred Thompson wasn't at last week's Republican presidential debate, but he still managed to be relevant, the Weekly Standard
                        says, thanks to the former senator's innovative pre-campaign strategy. More...Watch: Republicans Take Jabs
• John And Rudy's New York Revue
                     					| Watch• Andy Pays A Visit To The Book Fair• Dems Better On Energy, But Not By Enough
                     					| Watch• More StoriesCBS NEWS BROADCASTSThe Early Show: Celeb Spot: Three Could Be Charm Twice For Bloom
The third movie in the "Pirates" trilogy comes out this week, to go along with his "Lord of the Rings" trilogy. "Pirates of
                        the Caribbean: At World's End" is expected to rack up the same mega-numbers its predecessors did. More...Watch: Bloom's 'Pirate' Success

Doggy Mama Nurses Tiger CubsCBS News RAW: Three newborn tiger cubs who were rejected by their mother at birth are being nursed by a surrogate dog
